text: Researchers have revealed that four heavily populated areas in San Francisco are in danger of an imminent major earthquake. They all lie in the area of the bay on the San Andreas Fault system and have stored enough energy to make a disaster overdue - with three nearing or past their average recurrence interval. Experts say the new analysis reveals a quake would cause massive damage, and affect up to five million people in the San Francisco area.¬†http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-2791481/is-big-one-coming-scientists-reveal-four-san-francisco-neighbourhoods-say-critical-risk-earthquakes.html Sorry... ¬† ._.

text: All of you guys who hate are so full of crap. I would like to hear your opinions on what it would be like to be in that sitatuion, when the big one hits and California goes down. Oh that's right you wouldn't be able to tell anyone, your home would be destroyed and you would have no contact with the world. I look at this movie the same I did when 2012 came out by Roland Emmerich, the movie and the special effects may not be the best, but the Actors are here to tell a truth, that's their job, and they do, I know because I'm an actor myself. And from the trailer honestly the movie looks really good, the music was super eerie too, loved it. Everything about this movie looks good so far and the teaser was awesome so don't start crapping on it until you see it, that's my opinion. If its not a good movie then its not a good movie, can't help that, but until then......ya know?

text: School time:   in real life, there is a thing called the "San Andreas Fault" which stretches out from Los Angeles to San Francisco. It is a tectonic boundary of the Pacific Plate and the North American plate, that boundary is called the San Andreas fault. Rockstar (the developers of GTA) chose the name San Andreas from the fault to be a state based of California. They didn't just make it up. As you may know, in the GTA world, Los Santos is based off and is the equivalent to Los Angeles. Where did they get the name "Los Santos" you wonder? Well, in Spanish "Los Angeles" means "The Angels" in English. LA's motto is "The City of Angels". So then Rockstar wanted to get something similar to "Angels", and they came up with "Saints". So "The Saints" in Spanish translates to.... You've guessed it, Los Santos, and the motto to Los Santos is "The City of Saints". So Rockstar have origin with their names, they don't just make it up like said before.

text: "Please have Alex Daddario in a skimpy tank top, please have Alex Daddario in a skimpy tank top,Please have Alex Daddario in a skimpy tan-1:21 Thank you Brad Preyton(Director). Your a great guy lol."  Boobs aside,This movie looks alot better than I thought it would. It doesn't look campy and over the top like alot of other shitty disaster movies(cough,cough,2012). The movie looks like its going to take itself seriously. I think that The Rock is going to be a bad ass in this role. He's a pretty good actor when it comes to action movies and Hes been in a lot of good ones lately. I'm also really glad that Daddarios in this too. Shes one of those celebs who are very talented and have so much potential to be in great movies but for some dumb ass reason they end up in shitty ones(Percy Jackson, chainsaw massacre,etc). This could be the movie that makes her even more famous so she could play bigger roles in even more blockbusters. That way, the world could see more of her giant ti- er i mean, acting range lol. The.The special effects look pretty good. You can tell its CGI because our eyes are trained that way now, but the damage of the city and the collapsing buildings look solid. I know, its probably going to be a big,dumb action movie, but honestly thats all I want from this. Not a melodramatic, dull movie with barely annything happening(cough,cough, Day after Tomorrow.)¬†  So basically, I'm looking forward to this movie. I hope it turns out to be great as the trailer makes it look.   .

text: This is ridiculous. The San Andreas fault can't "break open." The Pacific and North American plates are moving against each other (transform plate boundaries), not away (divergent plate boundaries) or into each other (convergent plate boundaries.) And, no earthquake that happens in LA is going to be felt on the east coast. The largest earthquake ever recorded, the 1960 Valdivia earthquake in Chile, was a 9.5 magnitude quake. The affected land area (in terms of potential damage) extended roughly 500 miles north and south and roughly 190 miles east and west.  I hate Hollywood producers.

text: Sadly, the San Andreas Fault is real... You can look it up if you want to, you can see it on the map... It's that large mountain range crack or fault line going almost a line with California and boy it is the hugest fault line I seen visible on land... Either way, that fault line will erupt the largest earthquake anyone has ever felt and California is going to get the brunt of the force which worries me since my best friend lives in California... This large earthquake has more truth than the 2012 theory... It IS real and just like every other earthquake, they can't predict when... That's why they ask, "where will you be...?" I don't know where I will be but if I'm guessing, I hope no where near when it happens..¬†

text: Science time! The events portrayed of the San Andreas fault display the land splitting apart, creating channels, or sinking down. The sinking of land occurs in in Normal and Reverse faults, which creates the sinking of one plane if it is the Hanging wall or Foot wall, respectively, or from the creation of a fault basin where a shallow is created from the widening of a gap in the configuration of the fault line. But an even plane that is spreading apart, like the channel that you see The Rock drive up to, doesn't appear to be the work of faulting but of the creation of a Back-arc basin, which occurs when two tectonic plates are colliding and one plate sinks below the other, which is called subduction. The subducted plate melts as it enters the mantle and rises to the surface again, as it is less dense than the mantle's composition, the pressure forces the land to split to make room for the new melt to reach the surface. This can occur up to hundreds of kilometres away from where the plates collide.¬†  Unfortunately, the region of California is not a subduction zone ( the entire west coast used to be, as it created the Rocky Mountains), it is instead a passive margin for the most part, as the plates are not colliding. They are instead grinding, as the whole San Andreas fault complex is a transverse or strike-slip fault, where the two sides grind along one another like two strips of coarse sand paper traveling in opposite, parallel directions. To take the analogy further, if you imagine a grain on either strip coming into contact, they collide head-on, so in very small and localized areas you will see Normal or Reverse faulting. But on a whole, the grinding of the strike-slip is what creates the earthquakes in the region.¬†  So a correct depiction of the fault, lets take it a extreme for drama, that would create extreme destruction would be one side travelling 100m north and the other traveling 100m south, with land in close proximity to the main fault cracking, sinking or rising almost sporadically but certainly violently. As well as prolonged and intense earthquakes at least touching 8 on a Richter scale.

text: Ok, this is the first time that Ive put a comment on here other than sayin "good video" or "John Cena sucks"(lol) but this is ridiculous. San Andreas is referred to the San Andreas Fault, which this 'theory', scientifically known, has been around WAY before Rockstar came out with San Andreas(awesum game btw, I still play it to this day.) Its just absurd that people think this movie got the name from Rockstar. No, it did NOT get the name from that. People, though u may love video games, such as I do(yah I am a geek), please think outside the box, this world doesnt revolve around video games. Put reality aside from the fiction world(which sumtimes it does sound alot better than this bullshit-ass world) and know the facts. I know, Im gonna get alot of so-called 'trolls' talkin shit to me and all that, but come on man, have some common sense. Btw, since we're on the subject about 'rip-off': Starship Troopers came out BEFORE Halo, so if u think ST ripped off Halo...well, do ur research before u talk(which IMO, both r great)

text: San Andreas? 15th time the charm..  Yep Earthquakes I guess this year are back in vogue and how long has we seen California (or for that matter, Los Angeles in Gernal Take the plunge?  Let me rattle off a few of these..  Earthquake (1974), The Big One: The Great LosAngeles Earthquake(1990), 10.5 and it's sequel 10.5: Apocalypse (2004 and 2006 respectively. ,,¬† Megafault (2009) and yes, 2012 (2012..  See a pattern here? no? Okay they are all  1. Earthquake disaster films.. 2. They either involve Los Angeles, San Francisco , Portland Seattle, and yes the Yellowstone Volcano (Not to mention Mount Saint Helens.. 3. Millions (if not billions) die.. (Period) 4. and in the case of 2012, California and Yellowstone were interconnected .. go figure..  The point is this.. Disaster movies will still happen.. and Earthquake moies are perhaps one of the largest onee to sit ther eand take the brunt..  IN the end some ofthe movies are real (E.G. Earthquake and the Great Los Angeles Earthquake) as these are based on true sicence.. Most of the others, are so over the top they make the idea look silly and stupid at best..  And if you think San Andreas is any different/ Nope It's the same thing, but it mixes palusible with over the top..  My advide..Don't bother seeing it.. It's jsut all the other movies retold over and over and over and over and over again..¬†  So yeah I'l pass..

text: So much advertising, so much catastrophe. And if it does not occur in reality people will be disappointed?? I believe the film may showcase the human psyche knowing deeply that nature has been abused and it cannot go unpunished, and they expect this punishment to occur, so that they can rid themselves of the underlying guilt.. But the catastrophe in coming could be averted if people actually looked at nature as a being, and if people looked towards harmony, not the financial gain all the time. The planet is in harmony with itself. If you pull a string, it will pull it back. Humans have been pulling too much. What will happen? Is it not time we actually had a more spiritual content in catastrophe movies? Is it not time to raise awareness that we cannot abuse nature forever? Time to introduce new dimensions in your reality besides $.

text: The San Andreas fault is incapable of producing an earthquake stronger than 8.5. This movie is clearly only exaggerating any possible 'big one'. California will likely never suffer anything above an 8.0, which is what is needed to cause the dramatic devastation seen in the movie.   The real danger is the fault line near Seattle Washington, which is capable of producing earthquakes above 9.0 and tsunami. That is the real danger for america. The damage to Seattle could be dramatic.

text: I will be honest, when I saw 'San Andreas' I thought "A GTA Movie?" but the minute the ground shook I said, out loud: "Oh...San Andreas Fault..." then all my thoughts were plagued with "No matter how much you try to warn people most of us won't even bat an eyelash until the world is crumbling around us."¬† Even though this is a MOVIE about something that's possible though likely not in the way the movie will show, I still kinda see it as "Disaster Porn".¬† Ya know, like the big brother of "Destruction Porn".¬† I really don't enjoy these kinds of movies aaaaand I was gonna put reasons but lets just say I know I wouldn't really survive on my own in that kind of scenario let alone try to help anyone who's with me at the time.

text: As much as I love the GTA game, I agree that people are right about the gamers like me thinking of this as a joke. I actually thought this movie was going to be about the game. This movie will remind me of 2012 and Deep Impact, so I'm looking forward to that.  As for GTA, The GTA: San Andreas has the best storyline out of the GTA games (even GTA V, in my opinion). Sooner or later they will make a movie out of it. It would be extremely original, because 1) no movies having to do with the games have come out yet, and 2) no one has made a movie about the 1992 L.A riots (a popular one, at least (no offense)), which is what GTA: SA was based on. So looking forward to both movies :D

text: READ THIS!!!!!!!!! ALERT NO JOKEüò¢üò¢üò¢üòØüòØüòØ    When is the Big One due? Sometime in the next 30 years ‚Äî and as soon as tomorrow. With about 300 large fault lines running beneath it, California is one of the most seismically active parts of the world, and has 37,000 tremors a year. Most are too small to be felt, but seismologists believe a couple of fault lines in particular ‚Äî including the much-dreaded San Andreas ‚Äî could trigger a megaquake similar to the one that flattened San Francisco in 1906, wiping out entire neighborhoods in seconds. Today, geologists say, there's a 99.7 percent chance of a Big One of at least magnitude 6.7 striking California within the next three decades, with Southern California most at risk. Fears that a big quake is imminent in Los Angeles were stoked in March when two earthquakes, including a magnitude-5.1 quake in La Habra, cracked walls, triggered landslides, and sent furniture flying. "Sooner or later there's going to be the Big One," says U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) seismologist Kate Hutton.
author: Jamie Xx

text: READ THIS ALERT!!!!!!!!!üè†üè°üè¢üè£üè§üè•üè¶üèßüè®üè©üè™üè´‚õ™‚õ≤üè¨üè∞üè≠üóªüóºüóΩüóø‚õµüöüüö°üö¢üíí===üíÄüòñüëéüëé‚ùå‚ùå‚ùå‚ùå‚ùå‚¨á‚¨á  April 19, 2014  When is the Big One due? Sometime in the next 30 years ‚Äî and as soon as tomorrow. With about 300 large fault lines running beneath it, California is one of the most seismically active parts of the world, and has 37,000 tremors a year. Most are too small to be felt, but seismologists believe a couple of fault lines in particular ‚Äî including the much-dreaded San Andreas ‚Äî could trigger a megaquake similar to the one that flattened San Francisco in 1906, wiping out entire neighborhoods in seconds. Today, geologists say, there's a 99.7 percent chance of a Big One of at least magnitude 6.7 striking California within the next three decades, with Southern California most at risk. Fears that a big quake is imminent in Los Angeles were stoked in March when two earthquakes, including a magnitude-5.1 quake in La Habra, cracked walls, triggered landslides, and sent furniture flying. "Sooner or later there's going to be the Big One," says U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) seismologist Kate Hutton.  How bad would it be? "You would see buildings collapse, you'd see people trapped, you'd see roadways collapse," said Kelly Huston of California's Office of Emergency Services. "You'd see widespread destruction." Under the USGS's crisis scenario for a magnitude-7.8 temblor in Southern California, the soil-filled Los Angeles Basin would turn into a violently trembling Jell-O, causing major highways and airport runways to buckle, water and sewer pipes to crack, electrical and gas lines to sever, and thousands of fires to break out across the region. Those blazes could then be whipped into a frenzy by the Santa Ana winds. Fiber-optic cables running across the San Andreas would be torn apart, and infrastructure would take months, if not years, to repair. The hospitals would be swamped by 50,000 injured people, and at least 1,800 would die.  Are these predictions reliable? Scientists consider the Big One inevitable, though they still cannot predict exactly where or when it will occur. Seismologists have only really just begun to understand the complexity of the 60 fault lines running below Los Angeles alone, and often discover new faults only after a major earthquake has occurred ‚Äî as with Northridge in 1994, when a magnitude-6.7 quake killed 60 people. But they have real reason to be concerned about the inactivity of the San Andreas fault, the boundary at which the Pacific and North American plates grind against one another. Earthquakes occur when pent-up stress between tectonic plates is released along a fracture in the earth, known as a fault. In the case of the San Andreas, the southern section of the fault hasn't had a large quake for more than a century. "That means stress is building, building, building," said Rufus Catchings, a research geophysicist. "It's overdue for a really big one."  What about other fault lines? Though seismologists have long dreaded a San Andreas‚Äìbased quake, experts now fear that a tremor on the Puente Hills fault line could cause as much ‚Äî if not more ‚Äî damage. Running from the suburbs of northern Orange County straight through the densest neighborhoods of the Los Angeles Basin, a 7.5 quake on the Puente Hills line would affect millions ‚Äî including downtown L.A.'s 4 million residents alone ‚Äî killing up to 18,000 people, causing $250 billion in damage, and leaving as many as 750,000 households homeless, according to the USGS. "This is the fault that could eat L.A.," said USGS seismologist Sue Hough.

text: There was a D.J on satellite radio in the car who sounded like he had a N.Y or N.J accent and he wanted to started a "Hollywood is evil" campaign because there are so many apocalyptic movies being made today. The other month, I was shocked when I rented "Maze Runner" and discovered it is another movie about the world after over 90% of the world's people are killed.  There are also "love songs" about a couple being alive after the sky falls. Why do people support Hollywood and movies like this? Divergent, The Hunger Games, tat Will smith movie, Maze Runner and I am sure that at least 10-15 movies have been made since 2009 about over 90% of the world's people being killed and then starting over in a living in a military state where the people who survive after the apocalypse will wish they were dead and be used against each other. When you see The Maze Runner, you get the idea that people will be fighting machines. I don't want to go Terminator on everyone but, there is actually a company called Sky net and humanoid robots are becoming more and more of a reality. It probably already is and we're just being introduced to the idea or accepting this through seeing movies of men falling for robots.And I've seen a celebrity¬† on t.v joke about having a helicopter when the world ends. I am not saying I think the world will end and at this point I don't care. So many people not only refuse to believe the truth but, they will help prolong suffering and they will help cover up murder, rape and torture while accepting that their food is being poisoned. But, why are so many of these movies being made? Is this like 9-11 where someone will be able to stay mass murder was predicted or foreshadowed before it actually happened? Why are people watching movies like this and eating popcorn?

text: Question:(I don't mean to offend anyone, if this has done so already. I am just a very curious person, and I am not from CA) Why do people say CA is overdue for "The Big One"? Aren't Earthquakes unpredictable? If they were predictable, every populous area that is about to get a major earthquake would of been evacuated. It's like "The Big One" has a date of when it is suppose to happen, which must be so, or it wouldn't be labeled as overdue. And if it is overdue, and it could happen any day, how come the possibly effected areas aren't put on a notice of some kind, like something that says "You might wanna move somewhere else for [this amount of time] due to fears of 'The Big One." ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†  Anyway, my MAIN question is, how can you say "The Big One" is overdue, if earthquakes can't be totally predicted? ¬† ¬†  (Once again I DID NOT mean to offend anyone if this message has done so already.)

text: I LAUGHED MY BOTTOM OFF at this. I mean that, I was openly laughing at several points of this. IMPOSSIBLE premise, STUPID science, DUMB logic. The EQs hit and its the LAMEST onscreen effect, I mean "Earthquake" back in what 1977?, did a way better job depicting ground motion, Heck, "San Francisco" way back in 1936 did a WAY MASTERFUL better job depicting the 1906 quake. Here they just jiggle the camera and all the building start falling down like they were made out of stacked dominoes. What really made me laugh was watching this and thinking all the idiots out there who are going to think that large tall buildings are going to behave this way like they were all created on Blender. FAIL, go rent "San Francisco", Clark Gable, Spencer Tracy, Jeannette McDonald, great great movie, way better than this farce-spectacle.

text: Al-QIYAMAH (The Surrection) 75:1-40  I swear by the Day of Resurrection; And I swear by the self-reproaching person (a believer). Does man (a disbeliever) think that We shall not assemble his bones? Yes, We are Able to put together in perfect order the tips of his fingers. Nay! (Man denies Resurrection and Reckoning. So) he desires to continue committing sins. He asks: "When will be this Day of Resurrection?" So, when the sight shall be dazed, And the moon will be eclipsed, And the sun and moon will be joined together (by going one into the other or folded up or deprived of their light, etc.) On that Day man will say: "Where (is the refuge) to flee?" No! There is no refuge! Unto your Lord (Alone) will be the place of rest that Day. On that Day man will be informed of what he sent forward (of his evil or good deeds), and what he left behind (of his good or evil traditions). Nay! Man will be a witness against himself [as his body parts (skin, hands, legs, etc.) will speak about his deeds]. Though he may put forth his excuses (to cover his evil deeds). Move not your tongue concerning (the Qur'an, O Muhammad ) to make haste therewith. It is for Us to collect it and to give you (O Muhammad ) the ability to recite it (the Qur'an), And when We have recited it to you [O Muhammad ¬†through Jibrael (Gabriel)], then follow you its (the Qur'an's) recital. Then it is for Us (Allah) to make it clear to you, Not [as you think, that you (mankind) will not be resurrected and recompensed for your deeds], but (you men) love the present life of this world, And leave (neglect) the Hereafter. Some faces that Day shall be Nadirah (shining and radiant). Looking at their Lord (Allah); And some faces, that Day, will be Basirah (dark, gloomy, frowning, and sad), Thinking that some calamity was about to fall on them; Nay, when (the soul) reaches to the collar bone (i.e. up to the throat in its exit), And it will be said: "Who can cure him and save him from death?" And he (the dying person) will conclude that it was (the time) of departing (death); And leg will be joined with another leg (shrouded) The drive will be, on that Day, to your Lord (Allah)! So he (the disbeliever) neither believed (in this Qur'an, in the Message of Muhammad ) nor prayed! But on the contrary, he belied (this Qur'an and the Message of Muhammad ) and turned away! Then he walked in full pride to his family admiring himself! Woe to you [O man (disbeliever)]! And then (again) woe to you! Again, woe to you [O man (disbeliever)]! And then (again) woe to you! Does man think that he will be left Suda [neglected without being punished or rewarded for the obligatory duties enjoined by his Lord (Allah) on him]? Was he not a Nutfah (mixed male and female discharge of semen) poured forth? Then he became an 'Alaqa (a clot); then (Allah) shaped and fashioned (him) in due proportion. And made him in two sexes, male and female. Is not He (Allah Who does that), Able to give life to the dead? (Yes! He is Able to do all things).

text: OKOKOK KET ME TALK TO YOU ABOUT THIS MOVIE SPOILERS AHEAD  I was freaking laughing the whole time. Don't get me wrong, it's all action, it's good, but five minutes into the movie I was able to predict 90% of it. Have you seen Taken? 2012? You're gonna become a seer too! The Rock calling his daughter in a big house? Ok, obviously separated parents, mom's got new, rich boyfriend! Also, at the end of the movie the guy will die so the parents can get back together. Father is a rescue pilot? that's convenient, as well as all the cars, boats and planes they will casualty encounter to reach their destiny. University teacher speaking about history's biggest earthqueake, of a 9.5 in Chile? I bet you all I have the movie's earthquake will be of a 9.6  Don't get me wrong, it was good! I just don't think they wanted me to find it fun to the point I laughed half of the movie. Like, Kingsman at least is action/comedy, I don't think San Andreas Fault was one of them.

text: This is SOOO STUPID!!! I'm not a seismologist but I know earthquakes AT THIS MAGNITUDE CAN NOT HAPPEN at a transform fault line. ALL OF THE MAJOR EARTHQUAKES have occurred near convergent boundaries (90%) or in between the pressure of two convergent boundaries (10%) for example in Sichuan, China 2008. The highest a transform fault earthquake should reach, is a 7.0 magnitude but no more. THIS MOVE IS FICTION so don't worry about it.

author: Valentino Gallardo

text: I was reading up on a couple of things this movie got wrong. Things like, the San Andreas can't cause a tsunami. Or how earthquake faults don't crack open which is very true. And how the San Andreas can't create a 9.6 quake.  If you look at a San Andreas fault map on Google images, or maps or wherever, the fault actually goes into the Pacific Ocean once it gets to the San Francisco area. About two miles out to sea from the Golden Gate Bridge. And from what I heard, SOME parts of the fault line are locked. Meaning that it's under so much stress that it's not even moving. ( At lease I think that's what it means. So correct me on that if I'm wrong and if you know ). Now one things for sure, in Southern California, the San Andreas is locked. So the next time it moves, Southern California will feel it the most. Which will be a 8.0 quake or greater. I'm not sure if it's locked in the bay area. But if so, the next time it releases a next big earthquake in that area, would it create a tsunami?  Some people also say that when the next big one hits that it won't be as major as the movie shows. I have a book called 'Earthquake Storms' by John Dvorak. And it's based on the San Andreas. And it said that the S.A. has actually made other fault lines across California. Like the Hollywood fault, the Hayward fault which is in the San Francisco area I think, the Newport-Inglewood fault, and the San Jacinto fault. Not to mention a fault that was NOT created by the S.A., but is pretty powerful called the Puente Hills fault. Which runs through downtown L.A. and is putting the city at risk of experiencing a 7.5 quake.  And not to also mention another fault that was not created by the S.A. but is 30 times GREATER then the S.A. called the Cascadia subduction zone. Which is putting the West Coast of the U.S. at risk of a 9.2 or greater quake along with a 100 foot high tsunami. The Cascadia does connect with the San Andreas in Northern California. So when the next big one hits, what if the San Andreas were to trigger ALL of the other faults that I mentioned? Which is quite possible, and would naturally be way more disastrous but the movie doesn't mention that part?  Also in the movie 2012, it showed California sinking in to the ocean after a 10.9 quake. The book also says that the San Andreas will NOT cause California to fall into the ocean. Instead, the S.A. fault and it's many subsidiary faults are slowly tearing California apart, so much of what is CA today will be transformed into a collection of islands that are destined to be rafted northward across the Pacific.

text: Ok this the people who don't know what San Andreas really is and think it's a gta stunt, the San Andreas or as they say the San Andreas fault is the fault line over California's Southern country side and west coast side all the way to San Francisco Bay alongside the beach of Northern California, definition, a fault is a crack in the Earth's crust. Typically, faults are associated with, or form, the boundaries between Earth's tectonic plates. In an active fault, the pieces of the Earth's crust along a fault move over time. So following on to our conclusion, the moving rocks can cause earthquakes, and believe me, I know it's a lot of fun on the westside, but make sure you make it on time to reach the right side of the fault. Hope some people learned something from all of this.

text: Another cheesy American disasters movie - where despite everything no one swears, loses their head totally, or gets terribly injured on screen. Amazing how phones, wifi, etc still worked after the complete breakdown of infrastructure . I didn't see one mangled dead person or a body part, despite millions dying. Still, when the real thing happens soon enough, I can from the comfort of my armchair in the U.K, compare the film to the scene I see on news footage and make further observations as to it's honest and lifelike portrayal.

text: It's a lot more complicated than that. The crust is hard shell. It's attached to other faults underground. When Andreas goes, Cascadia fault off Oregon goes-Mammoth Lake-Long Valley Caldera in S.CA blows-its another Yellowstone-Yellowstone blows-New Madrid Fault line blows-the East Coast Continental Shelf fault plate blows-the Caribbean asphalt volcano underwater-the size of Yellowstone blows..then it's..bad.
